column4: anyone want to help me resize my /dev/sda1 ? i cant do it with gparted :(
is it mounted when youre trying to resize it?
yes,thats why i cant resize it
do you have a copy of knoppix?
i ve live cds but no knoppix
any live cd with gparted on it?
Core why do u keep putting that All People thing there, its fucking annoying
i would reccomment getting knoppix, its a very handy distro
ahy can i do  it within ubuntu
no, u cannot resize a mounted partition, but to have your root partition not mounted you need to be booting off a cd, knoppix im sure has a partition editor, and im sure that ubuntu doesnt
so i can only do it from live cd?
i believe so, unless you have another os on that you can boot to so that your partition isnt mounted
maybe, can u resize using fdisk, ive never done it
if u can, then yes, but u just have to boot the live cd so your partition isnt mounted
